meanings.definition: To work again or differently on (something)
meanings.sent1: She is reworking her essay to make it better.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys reworking old furniture to give it a new look.
meanings.sent3: The artist kept reworking the painting until it was just right.
meanings.sent4: The chef was reworking the recipe to add more flavor.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic spent hours reworking the engine to fix the problem.

meanings.definition: A revised or improved version of a piece of writing or music
meanings.sent1: The author published a reworking of her novel with a new ending.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra performed a beautiful reworking of a classic symphony.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's reworking of the famous play had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The designer created a stunning reworking of the original dress.
meanings.sent5: The artist's reworking of the song gave it a fresh and modern twist.
